articles.title: Joint European-Japanese mission to Mercury gets its first glimpse of the planet - Stuff.co.nz
articles.description: The European Space Agency said the captured image shows the Northern Hemisphere and Mercury's characteristic pock-marked features.
articles.content:
A joint European-Japanese spacecraft got its first glimpse of Mercury as it swung by the solar system's innermost planet while on a mission to deliver two probes into orbit in 2025.

articles.title: Mercury looks stunning in this 1st flyby photo from Europe and Japan's BepiColombo mission - Space.com
articles.description: It's the first of six Mercury flybys before BepiColombo enters orbit in 2025.
articles.content: The joint European-Japanese BepiColombo spacecraft captured this view of Mercury on Oct. 1, 2021 during the first of six flybys on its voyage to orbit the planet in 2025. (Image credit: ESA/BepiColom… [+3578 chars]
